The Ingredients How To Make
  • 3 potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
  • 30 ml olive oil
  • 4 pork sausages
  • 1 onion, peeled and chopped
  • 1 garlic clove, peeled and chopped
  • 5 ml chilli flakes
  • 2 carrots, peeled and chopped
  • 2 celery sticks, chopped
  • 6 ml dried rosemary
  • 400 g can chopped tomatoes
  • 300 ml chicken stock
  • 45 ml puy lentils
  • salt and pepper
  1. Preheat oven to gas mark 6.
  2. Toss the potato chunks in 10 ml olive oil, then spread out on a baking tray. Roast for 40 mins, until crisp and golden, turning a couple of times, during cooking.
  3. Meanwhile, add the remaining oil to a pan, and fry the sausages, until browned. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add the onion and garlic to the pan, and cook until soft.
  4. Add the chilli, carrots and celery, cook for 5 mins. Add 4 ml rosemary, the tomatoes, stock, lentils and season.
  5. Slice each sausage into 4 chunks, then add back to the pan. Simmer, covered, for 30 mins.
  6. When the potatoes are cooked, toss with some salt and the rest of the rosemary, then serve with the stew.
Not suitable for freezing.
